entry.title: Building PDF Open Source Services with Angular & GCP - PDF to Podcast
entry.summary: Welcome to the journey of building open source PDF service using Angular (Analogjs), Firestore, Cloud Storage, and CloudRun. This project serves as a platform for sharing my knowledge, continually learning best practices, and simultaneously contributing to the community. Demo: https://pdfun.xyz GitHub - dalenguyen/pdfun The solution is built around GCP ecosystem, itâ€™s better to deploy the project on GCP, so it can access their services. There are two parts of the solution: Web UI (Analogjs - Angular): handle user interaction Backend (Node - Express): process PDF files Have you ever wanted to turn your scripts, interviews, or even technical documents into engaging, conversational podcastsâ€”without hiring voice actors? Thanks to advancements in AI, you can now synthesize realistic multi-speakâ€¦

entry.title: What I Learned Applying to AI/ML Research Internships in India and Abroad
entry.summary:
Over the past year, Iâ€™ve applied to dozens of research internships in AI and Machine Learningâ€”both in India and internationally. Itâ€™s been a journey full of rejections, growth, and unexpected breakthroughs. Hereâ€™s what I learned: ðŸ’¡ Foreign research internships are extremely competitive. ðŸ” International labs are highly specialized and advanced. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ Indian labs are more accessibleâ€”and equally valuable. ðŸ“¬ Cold emailing is a skill, not just a strategy. Personalize every message. Mention their work. Be clear on why you're reaching out. ðŸŽ¯ The biggest lesson: Donâ€™t chase prestigeâ€”chase learning. If you're an undergrad trying to break into AI/ML research, Iâ€™ve been thereâ€”and Iâ€™m happy to help. Feel free to reach out!
AI #MachineLearning #ResearchInternship #ColdEmailing #UndergradResearch #CognitiveScience #Psychology #GrowthMindset #IndiaToGlobal

entry.title: Hats Off (And On Again): The Ridiculous Art of Tech Leadership
entry.summary:
Being a tech leader means juggling flaming hats while dodging meetings and shielding your devs from corporate nonsense. Let's talk about it. (a.k.a. Making up the plan as you go) Youâ€™re expected to â€œsteer the shipâ€ with a smile and a vaguely confident roadmap you assembled 20 minutes before your standup. Fake it. Then figure it out. That's the job. (a.k.a. fluent in C-suite buzzword and junior dev anxiety) One hour you're decoding â€œsynergize agile growth,â€ the next you're explaining to your devs why you're not switching the whole stack to Rust. Again. You protect your team from scope creep, chaos, and every â€œquick fixâ€ idea that lands in Slack at 4:57pm. It's not glamorous, but it's necessary. Spoiler: Culture isn't ping pong tables and pizza Fridays. It's trust. It's listening. It's making space for real humans with real thoughts. Radical, right? Youâ€™re not here to be a boss. Youâ€™re here to lead.
That means throwing out the old leadership playbook and building something better. ðŸ”¥ Read the full post at LeadDon'tCtrl
âœŠ Burn the playbook. Lead loud. Lead weird.

entry.title: Scientists Use Language Models to Decode Human Genes
entry.summary: In a recent breakthrough, researchers have adapted large language models to understand the human genome in much the same way they interpret text. By training on billions of letters of DNA, these models learn the patterns, grammar, and context of genetic sequences, unlocking new ways to predict how genes behave and how mutations might lead to disease. The model, named GeneLM, was developed by a team of computational biologists who recognized that DNA, like language, is a sequence governed by rules and structure. By applying techniques originally designed for understanding human language, they were able to predict gene expression levels, regulatory elements, and even the effects of non coding variants that were previously difficult to interpret. What makes this development powerful is the modelâ€™s ability to generalize. It can identify the function of genetic elements in regions that have never been studied, offering insights into rare diseases and complex traits. Unlike traditional methods, which often require specific biological annotations, this approach works directly from sequence data. Early tests show that GeneLM outperforms existing models in predicting gene activity and identifying potential disease related regions in the genome. Researchers believe it could become a foundational tool in genomics, much like language models have become in artificial intelligence. This line of research is still evolving, but it marks a shift in how we read and understand the human genome. By treating DNA as a language, scientists are beginning to unlock its meaning with unprecedented depth and speed. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41587-024-02100-1

entry.title: 11 Essential Frontend Development Tips for Beginners
entry.summary: The average person in the United States spends over 7 hours looking at a screen each day, according to Exploding Topics' 2024 screen time statistics. Much of that interaction is with websites and web applications, all brought to life by frontend development. If you're looking to step into this creative and in-demand field, understanding the fundamentals is key for starting frontend development. Frontend development is all about crafting what you directly see and interact with on a website or application. Itâ€™s the art and science of transforming design concepts into the responsive, functional digital interfaces that users engage with every day. Think of it as building the 'storefront' of the digital world. While the array of technologies involved might seem like a steep climb at first, remeâ€¦

Top 5 Things to Know Before You Buy Dedicated Server Germany
entry.summary: If you're planning to host your applications or websites in Europe, Germany dedicated servers are a popular choice due to the countryâ€™s strong data privacy laws, robust infrastructure, and strategic location. But before you buy a dedicated server Germany, itâ€™s important to understand a few key factors that can make or break your hosting experience. Germany is centrally located in Europe, providing low-latency connections to users across the continent. Major cities like Frankfurt serve as internet exchange points (like DE-CIX) that connect global networks. If you're targeting European audiences, dedicated servers in Germany ensure high-speed connectivity and excellent uptime. Not all providers offer the same network quality. Look for Germany dedicated servers that provide: Unmetered or highâ€¦

entry.title: How DIDI BHAIYA GANG ruined indian IT sector
entry.summary: The 'Didi Bhaiya Gang' Phenomenon: Unmasking the Illusion of India's Tech Influencer Culture In recent years, a new breed of tech influencers, colloquially termed as 'Didi Bhaiya', has emerged in India's digital landscape. These individuals, often former employees of prestigious tech companies like FAANG (Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, Google), have transitioned into full-time content creators, offering online courses and promising lucrative salaries to aspiring software developers. While their rise has been meteoric, so has the controversy surrounding their practices. The Rise of the 'Didi Bhaiya' Culture The allure of a high-paying tech job, especially in FAANG companies, is undeniable. Capitalizing on this aspiration, many influencers have crafted a narrative: "I cracked FAANG, so caâ€¦
